page.title: 04 CHAPEL PLAISTER.
page.content: { {Chapel Plaister}is raised up on a hill,and right beside the road,but many people don't even know it's there!The chapel got it's name {"Plaister"}from the{recreation space alongside it.Animals were kept and {maypole dances}held there.The Chapel was built in 1360 over a stone quarry,and with stone from the quarry.It was built for{pilgrims}to come in and rest on the way to {Glastonbury}Abbey.Services were held there every day in the morning and evening.There is a{tunnel}leading to {Hazlebury Manor}about 600 metres away. The Chapel has two{Basqueville Bibles which are over 200 years old.There was a{bell}hanging on a tree opposite the Chapel which was rung for services. Today services are held only occasionally.
